IRS990EZ.PrimaryExemptPurposeTxt: This corporation is organized exclusively for charitable and educational purposes within the meaning of section 501c3 of the Internal Revenue Code or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code The corporation seeks to support the educ

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990-EZ Part I line 10 Grants and similar amounts paid Contributions to JCS Elementary School - 6038 to classrooms at the JC Solmonese Elementary 315 W Main St Norton MA 02766 This charitable and educational program provides innovative lesson plans or new classroom supplies to all 498 students enrolled at the JCS Elementary School Once per year the organization invites each teacher in the school to request either a gift card to Teachers Pay Teachers an online resource for educators to share lessons material other resources or specific classroom supplies for use during the year with their students Teachers clearly demonstrate the need and planned use for each item Additionally teachers are invited to make requests for one-off items needed by the school or specific classrooms The organization considers these on a case by case basis before approving or declining any request Examples of items purchased this year include are rugs for classrooms to provide flexible and comfortable seating to students recess carts for the preschool program robots for 3rd grade tv dvd for OT specialists etc Norton Embracing Educational Development Inc - 1000 EIN 20-2383109 64 W Main St Norton MA 02766 This grant was made for educational purposes benefiting the preschool program at the JCS school 85 enrolled this year Together with NEED our organization funded a STEM Educational program for our youngest learners Mary ER Brown Scholarship 500 - Matthew Peterson 100 Maple St Norton MA 500 - Annabel Diestel 82 S Worcester St Norton MA Students are selected during their senior year the Norton High School Scholarship Committee and the award is paid after the successful completion of one semester of college Once validated by the committee the organization pays funds directly to student recipients American Red Cross - 396 EIN 53-0196605 431 18th Street NW Washington DC 20006 This charitable donation was made to help humanitarian and restoration efforts in the wake of Hurricane Irma The organization facilitated the collection of donations from students and faculty at the JC Elementary school Flurry of Wishes - 251 charitable giving coordinated the the JCS Elementary school 315 W Main St Norton MA 02766 This program provides several families with students enrolled at the JCS Elementary School with holiday gifts that would otherwise not be possible due to financial hardship The recipients are identified based on need by the schools adjustment counselor and to preserve confidentiality the identities remain unknown to the members of the organization It Takes a Community - 150 48 Harvey Street Norton MA 02766 This charitable donation was made as part of the ITAC annual basketball game The goal of the ITAC organization is to assist families in Norton who have suffered the loss of a loved one or who are coping with a serious or terminal illness or those who are dealing with financial hardships because of loss or sickness For this year ITAC assisted 10 families in Norton JCS Rock Garden - 109 315 W Main Street Norton MA 02766 The organization made a charitable and educational contribution to the JCS school community through the funding of this rock garden The students of JCS 458 enrollment read the book Only One You which celebrates the uniqueness of every person and painted a rock in the design of their choosing which were then placed in a landscape feature at the front of the school Total reported as Grants Similar Amounts Paid Form 990-EZ Part 1 line 10 8944 Form 990-EZ Part I line 16 Other Expenses The other expenses incurred by the organization for the tax year were in direct support of our exempt charitable and educational mission of supporting the education of students at the Joseph C Solmonese Elementary School Including building and fostering relationships between the school parents teachers and community Other expenses incurred this year include Booster Enterprises 26021 purchase of full in-school program for character lessons online support fun run t-shirts for each student Scholastic Book Fair 11177 Served as treasury support for 2 in-school fairs guided by JCS Elementary librarymedia specialist Field Trips 9073 sponsored field trips for students aimed at enhancing educational experience beyond the classroom Enrichment 6951 sponsored in-school programs requested by faculty to enrich curriculum for all students Fall Festival 3313 sponsored community building event for JCS families and any member of the broader Norton community Third Grade Yearbook 2786 provided sponsorship to ensure all third grade students faculty received a yearbook Donation to JCS 2119 one-time discretionary donations to the school eg area rugs book bins recess carts etc Gifts to JCS Community 1690 one-time discretionary gifts to JCS community members eg flowers for bereavement holiday gifts etc Ice Cream Social 1500 sponsored this community building event for JCS families to enjoy ice cream and entertainment Teacher Appreciation 1169 sponsored teacher appreciation luncheon and small 5-15 gifts for teachers at the school Third Grade T-shirts 1024 sponsored the purchase of t-shirts for each 3rd grade student to commemorate the end of their time at JCS DonutsMuffins Breakfasts 867 sponsored community building breakfast for each grade students families at the start of the year ReadyRefresh Water 652 sponsored ReadyRefresh water delivery for JCS Town water deemed not potable for portion of the year Third Grade Cookout 571 sponsored year end cookout celebration for all 3rd grade students to mark the end of their JCS experience Parent Teacher Conferences 562 sponsored dinner and refreshments for staff during parent teacher conferences Field Day Celebrations 516 sponsored field day celebrations including Popsicles for grades K-2 and Bubbleman performance for gr 1 Expert Fair 414 purchased poster boards and tent cards for all 3rd grade students for use in their expert fair projects Providence Bruins 198 served as treasurer for the PBruins community event for JCS families Halloween Parade 164 sponsored the JCS schools participation in the annual town Halloween parade Summer Reading 162 sponsored summer reading incentive prizes available for all students who completed the activity Sundae Party 91 sponsored an ice cream sundae party for all 1st grade students Little Lancers Graduation 73 sponsored graduation ceremony activity for pre-K students upon completion of their school year BooHoo Breakfast 68 hosted breakfast for any kindergarten parent or guardian who opted to attend on the first day of school Meeting Expenses 26 expenses associated with hosting and running meetings for organization members Returned Check Fee 7 fee incurred when Baystate Textile check was returned Total reported as Other Expenses on Form 990-EZ Part I line 16 71194 Form 990-EZ Part III Statement of Program Service Accomplishments This corporation is organized exclusively for charitable and educational purposes within the meaning of section 501c3 of the Internal Revenue Code or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code The corporation seeks to support the education of children at the Joseph C Solmonese Elementary School by fostering relationships between the school parents teachers and community Form 990-EZ Part III Statement of Program Service Accomplishments line 31 All expenditures reported on Form 990-EZ Part I line 10 Grants Similar Amounts Paid and Form 990-EZ Part I line 16 other expenses were related to program service accomplishments and represent the totality of spending for program service accomplishments for this tax year Please see information provided previously in this Schedule O filing for both Form 990-EZ Part I line 10 for detail of the 8944 spent on grants and similar amounts and Form 990-EZ Part 1 line 16 for detail of the remaining 33867 spent on other expenses
